result.title: Objective
result.description: Project Objective: Enhance coverage and management effectiveness of the protected area system of Montenegro by developing the capacity in protected area institutions to design, plan and manage a more representative system of protected areas

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Coverage (ha) of the protected area system

actual.comment:
172,764 ha
Piva consisting of an area of approximately 32,000 ha was proclaimed on April 22, 2015. Delay was caused by local elections and Article of the Law on nature protection stating that PA bordering any National Park (NP Durmitor in this case) should be managed by National Parks (and this is not acceptable for municipality of Pluzine since they insist on managing the Regional park). Following consultations on local and national level the decision was made for National parks to prepare a waiver transferring the management authority to Pluzine municipality. Following approval of the Government of Montenegro proclamation was granted.
Komovi RP - the park covers territory of three municipalities. Proclamation consists of two steps. First, legal prerequisites are met at the municipality level . Then the proclamation act for municipality?s territory is prepared and adopted, stating that a joint management body will be formed to manage the entire Park territory. Up to date Municipality of Podgorica proclaimed RP. Municipality of Andrievica is scheduled for September assembly session.
Municipality of Kolasin IS pending Ministry approval.
Dragisnjica/Komarnica - based on request form Ministry and municipality of Savnik (due to important biodiversity values and unique canyon of Komarnica) project finalized preparation of proclamation study Dragisnjica/Komarnica regional park.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Capacity development indicator score for protected area system

baseline.comment: Systemic: 37%

target.comment: Systemic: 47%

actual.comment:
Systemic: 50%
Indicator updated during preparation of TE by local evaluation experts

baseline.comment: Institutional: 49%

target.comment: Instit: 56%

actual.comment:
49%
A positive change of +1 score at the Institutional level since the baseline could not be properly captured by the overall percentage of institutional capacity. The EoP target was set at 7% increase over the baseline. But the increase of the score by 1 for the institutional capacity in the total of 45 points was not significant enough to trigger the change in the percentage. As such, the EoP target was not reached.

baseline.comment: Individual: 33%

target.comment: Individual: 57%

actual.comment:
38%
On the Individual level, the EoP target had to increase by 24% compared to the baseline level. The project invested significant efforts to improve individual capacities resulting in the positive change. However, the final target of 38% did not reach the EoP target of 57%.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description:
Total operational budget (including HR and capital budget) allocation (US$) for protected area management
[Indicator removed from logframe during Inception Workshop]

actual.comment: N/A; this indicator was removed from the logframe at time of Inception workshop.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description:
Financial sustainability scorecard for national systems of protected areas
[Indicator removed from logframe during Inception Workshop]

actual.comment: N/A; this indicator was removed from the logframe at time of Inception workshop.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Expanding and rationalising the PA system to ensure better habitat representation and more secure conservation status

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Percentage (by area) of the 32 Emerald Project sites (Areas of Special Conservation Interest, representing habitat types and species of biodiversity significance) incorporated into the protected area system

actual.comment: 32 EMERALD sites are covering 18.45% (254,931 ha) of Montenegro territory. Out of this area 102,383 ha is overlapping with territory of existing PAs (40.2%). Komovi and Piva Regional Parks, both of which are EMERALD sites (pls refer to progress update of Objective level indicator 1 above). This increased the total area of EMERALD sites covered by PAs by approximately 47,800 hectares.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number and area of formally proclaimed Marine Protected Areas

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Extent (ha) of formally proclaimed IUCN Category III Regional Park

baseline.comment: 0ha

actual.comment:
47,800 ha
Proclamed Piva RP and Podgorica part of Komovi RP.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Strengthening capacity of PA institutions to more effectively manage a representative system of protected areas

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of protected areas with formally delegated management institutions

actual.comment:
18
Proclaimed Piva RP and Podgorica part of Komovi RP.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of protected areas with an effective and properly resourced management institution

actual.comment:
16
Proclaimed Piva RP and Podgorica part of Komovi RP.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: METT score for IUCN Category I, II and III protected areas

baseline.comment: Biogradska Gora: 60%

target.comment: All IUCN Category I,II and III PAs 65%

actual.comment: METT score 68

baseline.comment: Durmitor: 48%

actual.comment: METT score 72

baseline.comment: Lovcen: 46%

actual.comment: METT score 67

baseline.comment: Skadar Lake: 59%

actual.comment: METT score 68

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of planning support and operational national park staff completing specialised training and/or skills development programs

actual.comment:
46
Training for rangers of National parks

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Number of beneficiaries from communities in and around Komovi regional park

target.comment: Experiential training completed: 400 local decision-makers, adult and/or secondary school learners

actual.comment:
20 beneficiaries
Trained as a part of NGO support grants

target.comment: Local business trained and financed: 3

actual.comment: Grant scheme fully completed, 18 entities supported. The program was supported by project in amount of 25,000 USD, and generated additional support and investments form targeted businesses exceeding 100,000 USD.

location.name: Podgorica
location.activity-description: Procurement and Installation of Document Management System in Environmental Protection Agency, Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism, Centre for Eco-Toxicological Research and Institute for Hydro-Meteorology and Seismology in Montenegro.

location.name: Montenegro
location.activity-description: Ministry for Sustainable Development and Tourism and Agency for Environmental Protection.

location.name: Kotor
location.description: seat of a first-order administrative division
location.activity-description: Procurement and Installation of Software for Document Management System in Institute of Marine Biology.

result.title: Objective
result.description: To analyze, indentify and pilot advanced tools and practices for environmental information management and compliance monitoring and to develop capacity of institutions for global environmental management by institutionalizing identified tools and practices.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Environmental Management Information System (EMIS) and indicator framework for global environmental management developed and applied on a pilot basis

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Set of environment indicators developed and agreed amongst various stakeholders

baseline.comment: A number of indicators exist, but these are structured according to standard environmental, social and economic criteria and metrics. These indicators are not consistently interpreted against global environmental criteria, nor are they uniformly accepted as valid metrics of sustainability

target.comment: Beginning of the project Four weeks from Project Inception

actual.comment:
Environment Protection Agency (EPA) Montenegro upgraded the aggregate indicator for biodiversity with an indicator for plants, fungi and lichens in Montenegro through re-installation of the National Herbarium in EPA Montenegro. Thus, the institutional capacities of EPA Montenegro were strengthened in re-installation and putting in function of National Herbarium including adequate storing and its further maintenance, as well as in the area of scientific processing and determination of herbarium material. All the results obtain contributed to: i) strengthening scientific work in the area of biodiversity in Montenegro, ii) defining baseline for preparation of biodiversity related project proposals, iii) increased institutional knowledge exchange in the area of biodiversity.
In addition, the aggregate indicator for air quality included a new indicator on pollen concentration. Consequently, institutional capacities of EPA were strengthened in managing the national pollen monitoring system and determination of pollens phenotype present in the air. In addition, a web based system for informing citizens about health problems caused by pollen has been established.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Data Flow System developed and agreed amongst various stakeholders reporting data on CBD, CCD, FCCC and issues

baseline.comment: Although there are multiple agencies managing environmental data, coordination between and among these to reconcile their data collection methodologies and standards are weak

target.comment: Beginning of the project Ten weeks from project Inception

actual.comment: Detailed Assessment (Study) on EPA's IT System was developed, scanning the existing situation in EPA in the IT sector, including assessment of the existing: software, indicators, reporting obligations in various areas (biodiversity, waters, air etc.), input data, IT processes, verification, data received from other environmental institutions etc. Having in mind that the EC Delegation in Montenegro allocated significant funds for development of comprehensive environmental information system for EPA, the full assessment was submitted to EC for their further use, i.e. development of the IT system as per EPA's needs.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Development and adoption of web-based advanced tools for environmental data and metadata storage by stakeholders.

baseline.comment: There is limited availability of web-based tools for analyzing environmental data, with these limited to closed network sharing within particular agencies, and not structured to sharing across agencies and key user-stakeholders

target.comment: Mid-term goal of the project 60 weeks from project inception

actual.comment: Having in mind the IT Assessment produced, as well as the existing project of the European Commission Delegation in Montenegro, the Management Board decided that the Document Management System (DMS) should be installed in five environmental institutions in Montenegro: Environment Protection Agency, Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism, Hydro-Meteorological Institute, Institute for Marine Biology and Center for Eco-Toxicological Research. The benefits of DMS are many. The system has been installed and it is in the piloting phase.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Pilot application of EMIS in relation to National Spatial Plan-2020 and Tourism Master Plan-2020

baseline.comment: Montenegro has recently begun reporting national indicators relevant to Rio Conventions, e.g., the Initial National Communication. However, individual policies, programmes, strategies, and plans are not individually assessed in terms of their unique contribution to Rio Convention obligations

target.comment: Mid-term Project Goal- 70 weeks from project Inception

actual.comment: The Second National Communication was adopted by the Government of Montenegro and submitted to the UNFCCC Secretariat. The revision of the National Biodiversity Strategy is still on-going.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Institutional capacity of the Environmental Protection Agency strengthened to perform compliance monitoring in relation to global environmental conventions and a system of knowledge management established

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Utilization of indicators for formulation of environmental policies and monitoring of variables for reporting environmental commitments

baseline.comment: Indicator-based information is not effectively used to formulate environmental policies and monitoring of variables for reporting

target.comment: End Term Project Goal-140 weeks from project inception

actual.comment: List of indicators was updated, in relation to: aggregate biodiversity indicator (updated with the indicator for plants, fungi and lichens) and aggregate air quality indicator (upgraded with the indicator for pollen).

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Training programme developed and delivered to EPA and other project stakeholders

baseline.comment: EPA staff and stakeholder organizations are not trained on the use of advanced planning and information management tools (which are to be developed under the project)

target.comment: Mid-term Goal 70 weeks from project Inception

actual.comment: Trainings in using Document Management System (DMS) were organized for all five environmental institutions in Montenegro: Environment Protection Agency, Hydro-Meteorological Institute, Institute for Marine Biology, Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism and Centre for Eco-Toxicological Research. Altogether, more than 100 individuals from mentioned institutions were trained in using DMS.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Identification of focal points in stakeholder Institutions that would coordinate the inputting of data and informational requirements in the indicator and web-based EMIS to foster environment sustainability as theme managers

baseline.comment: There is very limited to no coordination amongst EPA and other stakeholders on data collection, management, and sharing, which exacerbates the use of different metrics for assessing environmental indicators

target.comment: Beginning of the project Four weeks from project Inception

actual.comment: Nominated focal points continued with their regular work and reporting.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: M&E and risk management protocol developed

baseline.comment: M&E protocols targeted to assessing environment and development policies, programmes, and plans are not available

target.comment: Beginning of the Project: Ten weeks from project inception

actual.comment: The 8th Steering Committee meeting was held on 13th October 2014, confirming the activities implemented to date and approving action plan and related budget for the forthcoming period. In addition, so called consultative meetings with main stakeholders groups were held for all projects implemented by the Centre for Sustainable Development (CSD) and Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism. The one for this and climate change related projects was held in September 2014. The major topic discussed at those meetings was added value of the project(s), especially in relation to the EU accession process and compliance with UN Conventions reporting requirements.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Web-based environmental project database established

baseline.comment: Data and information is currently managed on a case-by-case basis, with limited sharing among project stakeholders. Data and information is not web-based.

target.comment: End goal of the project: 140 weeks from the project inception

actual.comment: The same trend of posting data and information generated within the project on relevant web sites has been followed further during reporting period July 2014 - June 2015. In addition, linkages with other projects were made, e.g. in the meantime the Second National Communication was finalized, adopted by the Government, published and uploaded on the web sites: ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism - http://www.mrt.gov.me/biblioteka/izvjestaji , UNDP Montenegro - http://www.me.undp.org/content/montenegro/en/home/library/.

location.name: Cetinje
location.description: seat of a first-order administrative division
location.activity-description: The project is dealing with economic revitalization of the old royal capital Cetinje trough urban reconstruction of the cultural heritage with energy efficiency considerations, provision of vocational trainings, support to small businesses and encouraging green design ideas and innovations.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Number of unemployed trained for retrofits/reconstruction of objects of cultural heritage and public spaces and green businesses 2. Number of unemployed hired for retrofits/reconstruction of objects of cultural heritage and public spaces and green businesses 3. Decrease of energy consumption /CO2 emissions decrease 4. Number of cultural heritage objects and public spaces retrofitted/reconstructed

baseline.comment: 1. 0 unemployed in Cetinje trained for retrofit of objects of cultural heritage 2. 0 unemployed in Cetinje hired for retrofits/reconstruction of objects of cultural heritage and public spaces and green businesses 3. Average energy consumption in objects of cultural heritage (200 Kwh per m2) and GHG emissions (CO2 emissions 70 t/kWh) 4. 0 objects of cultural heritage and public spaces retrofitted/reconstructed

target.comment: 1. At least 10 unemployed trained for retrofit 2. At least 10 unemployed hired for retrofits/reconstruction 3. CO2 emission decreased 4. Energy consumption decreased by at least 30% in retrofitted building 5. At least 1 cultural heritage object retrofitted/reconstructed & at least one public space reconstructed

iati-activity.title: Access to Justice for Victims of Violence in Family
iati-activity.description: Project will look into perceptions present in the judiciary on violence in family working to reduce predominant patriarchal stereotypes on gender roles and therefore latent excuse for gender based violence by judiciary representatives

document-link.title: BUDGET Access to Justice for Victims of Violence in Family 18th December

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
- Number of amendments on Law from Protection from Violence in Family aligned with Istanbul Convention
- Number of representatives of judiciary trained on Istanbul Convention Provisions on violence in family

baseline.comment:
- O laws adjusted in accordance with Istanbul Convention
- Representatives of judiciary do not adequately apply Istanbul Convention Provisions in addressing violence in family

target.comment:
- At least 5 amendments prepared on the Law from Protection from Violence in Family aligning it with Istanbul Convention
- Representatives of judiciary largely apply Istanbul Convention Provisions in addressing violence in family

actual.comment: - Created 5 amendments on the Law on Protection from Violence in Family - Judiciary largely informed about Istanbul Convention Provisions in addressing violence in family - Increased reporting of cases of violence in family for criminal offences for 12,5% and for misdemeanor cases for 22% within one year - Accredited UNDP educational program Access to Justice for Victims of Violence by national Centre for Education of Judges - Research on perceptions of judiciary on gender based violence has been assessed revealing that in general, every second representative of judiciary thinks that violence in family is private matter and should not be reported to institutions but solved between family members - Fourteen representatives of judiciary have been supported to become peer educators - Tailored Educational Program on violence against women attended by 98 representatives of judiciary.

iati-activity.title: Grant Management of PCB waste
iati-activity.description: The objective of Project Preparation Grant is to develop a full-sized project aiming to establish environmentally sound management of PCBs in Montenegro.

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. An assessment report on analysis of policy and regulatory reform needed for the implementation of the obligations of the Stockholm Convention, also identifying national needs and gaps to strengthen institutional capacity to implement the Convention 2. Inventory of Polychlorinated biphenyl (PCB) assessed and plan for sampling and testing of equipment during Project Preparation Grant (PPG) phase developed and testing completed. 3. Identified possible ways for decontamination and disposal of Polychlorinated biphenyl (PCB). 4. Stakeholders involvement ensured.

baseline.comment: 1. The Montenegro legislation on Polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) establishes that PCB containing equipment has to be identified and phased-out by 2020. Montenegro is a party to the Stockholm Convention since 2010 and the National Action Plan for the implementation of the Convention was adopted in 2013. 2. Comprehensive inventories of the existing PCB equipment at national so at the holders sites is not developed. 3. No data on storage and removal of the obsolete equipment and waste oils containing PCB by PCB equipment owners, uniform instructions for identification, decontamination, use, transport, storage and disposal of PCB equipment or products. 4. So far no joint action from the stakeholders involved in this issue has been taken, no coordination and information sharing among them.

target.comment: 1. An assessment report drafted. 2. Inventory assessment, plan for sampling and testing developed, and 30% of planned samples tested. 3. All data on possible ways for decontamination and disposal technics collected. 4. All stakeholders enrolled in project preparation.

actual.comment: 1. Assessment report finished 2. All planned samples tested 3. Data on possible ways for decontamination collected 4. Stakeholders enrolled in project preparation
